reviews.review_msg: She makes the class so dry by reading off the slides. The text book she has picked up for the class is way too hard for a 200 level class (even the ta said so).
Reads off lecture slides and does not sound interested in the subject at all. Lecture slides are mostly straight quotes from readings. Would not recommend.
Jody is one of my most memorable profs at SFU. Lectures are so clear and concise.

In first year I thought jody was amazing. By 3rd year i realised he's not that great. He's a good speaker, but tbh he's just readingt he slides Hes not a bad teacher i like him but in 3rd year but I never went to class (4 a reason). He's usually a fair marker but I've had a few weird curveballs where my grade dropped dramatically for weird things

One of the good ones. You can truly tell that he loves teaching the course and is good at what he does. He puts a lot of effort into his teaching material so all students can understand properly. Through his teaching methods and overall performance, he was passionate, encouraging, and aside from his rant stories, he was straight to the point.

Jody and the TA's are very good at helping students succeed. Papers have deadlines but if they need to be extended/handed in late no marks will be taken off. There is some presentations in tutorials but they are not hard and quite fun. This class is very paper heavy but not hard to do well in.

Helpful and accessible during office hours, gives great advice! There aren't slides for every lecture like most other classes have; it's a diff style but doesn't make the class harder just forces you to pay attention to what he's actually saying. Always brings in loads of examples and relevant content. Excited to take more classes with him.
Jody is very articulate, enthusiastic and knows what he is talking about. He keeps the lectures interesting and isn't boring at all.
One of the best teachers I had. Super funny, super articulate, makes everything really easy to understand
Jody is an awesome professor!!! He's hilarious, lectures are always organized and he even provides lecture videos online. He's very engaging and always available for feedback in office hours.

One of the best profs in the faculty of cmns at SFU! His classes, both 223 and 323 go hand-in-hand. The critical thinking and writing skills that are encouraged and taught go a long way when entering higher upper division courses. Both Prof and his TA's work well together. Plus Jody is full of character, honest, and lectures are very well prepared.

There was so much hype around Jody but honestly he SUCKS. Lectures were so pointless, always rambled about BS. Go to tutorials if you want to learn something. Do not get me started on the assignments.. we had to present a creative project to him that he told us was going to be chill BUT he decided to mark us as if we were actual advertisers. JUDGY.

This was my second class with Jody, and I couldn't have enjoyed either class more. He's a thorough and enjoyable lecturer who really cares about his students understanding the material and succeeding with their work. He does go through material very quickly, but posts his slides on canvas, so you can go back if you miss anything. Jody is the best

Jody is very eccentric and very engaged with the theory of the course, which makes it fun to attend lecture. He provided the readings online, most of which were interesting and helpful. If you pay attention and understand the theory, the assignments aren't hard at all. Would take again.

Jody always replies to my emails usually only within one day. He gives lots of detailed feedbacks, I would email Jody instead of the TAs. I didn't miss a single one of his lectures! Best communications prof at sfu.

Had Jody for CMNS 223W intersession Summer 2017. Would recommend this course if you are considering intersession. Pace was not too quick however readings will catch up if you leave them.  Readings are necessary to do well on the papers and to have a better understanding of course concepts as Jody can sometimes be all over the place

Jody is one of the best CMNS profs out there. He's extremely personable, engaging, and funny, and can make what seems like boring material very interesting. He sometimes goes off on tangents about his personal life but it doesn't really detract much from his lectures. My only complaint is that he doesn't normally have lecture slides.
Really don't understand what all the fuss is about surrounding this course. Was just a normal cmns class and tbh Jody wasn't all that great in my eyes. Was just a normal course.

He's super kind. If you drop him an email he will help clarify assignments for you and eve give you an extension if you're having trouble. But I honestly don't get what the hype over him is about. He's funny but he doesn't get to the point in class which can get frustrating. Tends to go off on a tangent talking about his own life.

Jody Baker is hilarious and obviously very into what he teaches. If you're a Communications student, or are thinking of pursuing Communications, I highly recommend him. He also provides his reading for the class so you don't have to worry about textbooks!
Great prof!

Absolutely fantastic prof, he was funny, entertaining, informative, helpful and passionate. The assignments were hard, lots of writing but the material was so interesting and I enjoyed coming to class every week. One of my best prof experiences at SFU.

Always available for help outside of class, gives great one on one feedback. Keeps lectures interesting, even when material can be dry. Would take any one of his classes just to have him as a prof again.

Jody is the greatest prof I have ever had at SFU hands down. Can't say enough about him. He loves what he teaches and his amazing character shows in his teaching. Hilarious guy. 1on1 help is unbelievable, allows rewrites on papers and basically helps you write them. Open book exam, no midterm. Genuinely cares about helping you do the best you can.

Very nice guy who is very interested in the subject. Has slides that he breezes through during lecture but puts them and voice recordings online. 3 small essays and one final all with peer reviews first. Open book, laptop, room final exam. Make sure you do the readings as they are greatly linked. Puts on a very enjoyable lecture. Would take again.

Professor Baker is my all-time favourite prof. He is incredibly entertaining and funny, while also engaging the course concepts. One-on-one he is very helpful with developing one's ideas. The syllabus is very interesting and a joy to learn about.
love him!!! Jody is one of the best prof ive ever encountered. really passionate, and funny. wish there's more profs like him :)

I took CMNS223W and CMNS220 this semester with Jody. He's an awesome prof, and his TA's this semester were pretty awesome as well. Assignments are fairly easy if you do the readings and the exam is open book! I had a great semester learning from Jody!

Likes to talk. I really enjoyed the subject matter as well as the lecture and discussions in tutorials. He was very helpful and interesting. I would take him again. He cares about students and their learning experience.
Take a class with this guy if you can. He is very interested in what he teaches, is an excellent teacher and wants to help you succeed.
